summary: The video showcases innovative sustainable materials and technologies presented at the Future Fabrics Expo. It highlights eight featured innovations, including grape leather, compostable shoe components, biofur textiles made from hemp and linen, bag buckles grown from microorganisms, dyes and inks from coffee waste, natural fibers that can replace plastic injection molding, sustainable color dyes mimicking DNA strands, and natural printing methods inspired by nature. The video also briefly mentions hemp high heels and digitally colored jeans as honorable mentions, encouraging viewers to share the video to promote these innovations.
transcript: The future of fashion. This is the future of fashion. Here are 8 of our favorite innovative materials. Here are 8 of our favorite innovative materials at the Future Fabrics EXPO. Future Fabrics Expo. 8. Planet of the Grapes. This is grape leather made from the leftovers of the winemaking industry. 7. Purified X Rootful. These shoe components are grown and can then return to the earth after their use. 6. Biofur. They make fur-like textiles from materials like hemp and linen, removing the need for plastic or animal furs. 5. Valupa. Grow clothing components like bag buckles by feeding microorganisms with starch. 4. Caffe Inc. Take coffee waste and use it to make dyes and inks. 3. Simplifyber. Make natural fibres into a liquid so that they can replace plastic injection moulding. 2. Colorifix. Growing sustainable colour dyes by mimicking DNA strands found in nature. 1. Living Systems Lab. Exploring natural printing methods with nature as the inspiration. Some final honorable mentions include these hemp high heels. These plant based leathers and these jeans that are coloured digitally. Share this video to help these innovations reach more big fashion brands!
